blocks.content: A Form helps Template designers in grouping Inputs that have a thematic connection. Forms are semi-active components as they do not directly collect data from users. Like Tasks, they help organize the data collection strategy. They are elements that allow the display of input fields in a compact manner. It is especially useful for rapid input of data.

points.text: Select the Form Step icon:
Choose where you want to put the Form Step in the orange bar below
Add Form text to the input field
Add different Input elements into the Form Step
Validate the Step by clicking the green tick:

blocks.caption:
Form display the web
This Template uses a Form to thematically group the instructions. Here, they have been used to provide a small sign off form on a Template needing final verification. Note the key characteristic of the layout of forms that provide a more compact view.

blocks.content: You can easily fold and unfold any structural element containing other elements. Simple tap on the arrow on the right of the element cell in the table.
